item.title: Home Server
item.description: Intro I’ve finally setup my own server. It’s great and I regret I haven’t done it earlier. This post will be about my thoughts and experiences on setting up a home server. In my case a server is just a Raspberry Pi 4B so it’s not a typical server with over 40 CPU cores and over 256 GB of RAM but technically it’s still a server and it’s enough for my use.

item.title: Building a small form factor PC
item.description: Intro At the beginning I want to say, thank you, to Tymek for introducing me into SFF and general building a PC area. He also gave me a lot of tips and advices which surely saved me many hours of reading hardware specs. For last ten years I’ve been using laptops as my main interface for programming and browsing Internet. Reason for that was me being a student for whom battery life and device’s weight was more important than better specs.
